subject: is JUnit still being maintained ?
msgSnippet: From: Vladimir R. Bossicard  [.. about using JUnit addons ..] ... JUnit 3.8.1 was released on September 4, 2002. I saw that this bug
messageBody:
From: "Vladimir R. Bossicard" <vladimir@...>
[.. about using JUnit addons ..]
> If you've been beaten by "expected <......> but was <... ...>" I bet you
> will :-)

JUnit 3.8.1 was released on September 4, 2002.
I saw that this bug was already entered twice in the sourceforge bugbase.

Also, a patch has already been submitted to solve this.
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=657593&group_id=152
78&atid=315278

Does anybody know when we can expect this item resolved in a new release of
JUnit (eg: 3.8.2)

I could just "work around" the problem with the JUnit-addons package,
but that just feels wrong for such basic functionality.

I suspect the maintainers are busy doing other good deeds for humanity,
so is there any way I can help to fix this and make a new release ?

Thanks,


Jeroen Mostert

-- mailto:jeroen@... http://www.jmmostert.com
-- It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare,
-- It is because we do not dare that they are difficult
